ygData.subject: RE: Vox Dead on Tarew Marr
ygData.msgSnippet: Bah!  Not worthy?? BAH! This reminds me of some clerics who say ...only the tanks get symbol buffs... Now what kinda logic is that?  Your casters have the
ygData.messageBody:
Bah! Not worthy?? BAH!

This reminds me of some clerics who say "...only the tanks get symbol
buffs..." Now what kinda logic is that? Your casters have the lowest hp/ac
and so who do you decide to help first? The ones with the most hp/ac???
Pretty dumb is you ask me - same deal with this loot - damn good item for
bard's and because they are weaker 'need' these items more - sheesh.

Sylly Songsynger
<Spirit of the Moon>
Bard of the 37th song
dead somewhere on Innoruuk



-----Original Message-----
From: M Sanford (Maev) [mailto:pr0teus@...]
Sent: Saturday, December 04, 1999 9:15 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Vox Dead on Tarew Marr

From: "M Sanford (Maev)" <pr0teus@...>

One issue that was raised on this Vox raid really popped a
vein in my
forehead.
It was when it came around to randoming off the Runed
Bolster Belt.
This is an ac 5, +10 str, +10 dex, +10 sta belt with haste
effect. The
question was raised if bards were worthy of this item, given
their melee
abilities etc. The way I look at it is the way Verant
designed us.. if I
had my choice between that belt and any instrument in the
game
(Maestro's lute for example), I'd glady choose the belt.
Surely the item
would be best in the hands of a monk, warrior, rogue, or
ranger. But is
a bard deserving of an item like that? What do you all
think?

Maev Lorekeeper
Tarew Marr
